website_summaries.verdict: The Echo Studio is the biggest and best-sounding speaker Amazon has produced to date.
pros: The Amazon Echo Studio produces a monstrous cloud of sound that works great with action movies and spacious styles of music
It offers a lot of features, including Dolby Atmos, excellent connectivity and Fire TV hookup, for a relatively affordable price
cons: The sound isn't always very distinct, which makes it less suitable to showcasing 3D music or Atmos
Multiroom support lags behind Sonos and Apple AirPlay
Dolby Atmos soundtracks require a Fire TV device

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound and listening skills
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best sounding home assistant that is currently on the market. The microphones have been substantially improved so it can pick up your wake word even while the music is playing at a higher level. No more screaming at Alexa in this house!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T LISTEN TO MY ECHO STUDIO BECAUSE NO POWER CORD WAS INCLUDED
customer_reviews.text: I Can't Listen to my echo studio because the power cord was not included and AMAZON WON'T SEND ME A CORD.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a clue why anyone would say it doesn't play music nor work. This thing plugged into my wireless network as easily as all the other Alexa devices. Music playback is better - much better - than the other Echo devices (because of the speakers). It does very well with Amazon HD music giving me a sense of directionality! It is integrated with my HiFi system and TV all without a lot of extra effort. Definitely worth it....
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Wegrzyn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't respond to music request, great sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't play music. I tried both Amazon Music Unlimited HD and Spotify. It would repeat my command but will do nothing after that. When paired with Fire TV Stick 4k ( this creates a speaker group in the Alexa app), the tv audio works but basic standalone device functionality (play music) is broken till I I unplug and replug the device. I tried this with the TV on and off; it made no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Ankit Potdar

customer_reviews.title: Worth It, Worth It and Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I am an echo nut (after the ability to group and the addition of Sirius XM) so I have a good selection of types and generations. This Studio is something. For the money I can't imagine finding something that sounds as rich and fills a room (or two or three) with such a tidal wave of music. Paired it with the sub and will get in line for another to create a stereo pair. Stopped in the Amazon store on 34th Street and they had just one playing - you could not tell where the music was coming from, it was just everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Burnsu2

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected Goodness
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible product I have purchased all Echo products and this is has far exceeded my expectations. I worry about the concerns of the microphones listening in on ur conversations but take comfort they can be turned off. The sound is rich, enveloping and awesome. I have an open room 24x 16 but a smaller room would be so much richer. The sound carries at full volume with barely any distortion. Brava amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Angel L. Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: Maybe released before really ready?
customer_reviews.text: Voice response seemed worse than my Echo Show v2. The music sounded pretty good when it worked, but it was pretty glitchy with Spotify interaction. Finally, it emitted a buzzing sound along with any voice responses. That was the deal-breaker and it got boxed back up and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Great One

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality was Harsh & Unrefined Compared to Homepod & Sonos
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the sound quality and not the quantity. It gets very loud, but the sound is harsh and unrefined compared to my Homepod and Sonos speakers. With the sound quality being below standard, it ruins any benefits of 3D music. Timbre is unnatural and sounds overly processed, even with 3D spatial turned off. It basically sounds like a very loud Echo Plus with more bass. The bass is also overdone and boomy for music. If you are not an audiophile or particular about sound, these issues that I mention may go unnoticed. It gets loud though and Alexa is of course awesome. I wish I could give 2.5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Ultra HD and 3D music for the masses!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what some of the reviewers are saying. My echo studio plays beautiful music. I listen to Amazon HD, Apple, Spotify. I heart radio. Works beautifully. I also have it on my everywhere group to enjoy music throughout the house. The added clarity and added bass is great. The 7 microphones do a better job of catching my voice even in a loud environment. Try listening to Ultra HD or 3D music. No going back.
customer_reviews.author: NWMike

customer_reviews.title: Amazon has a winner on its hands!
customer_reviews.text: This is an exceptional product. For the small package that its in, the sound is detailed. It's in stereo. And it provides bass that is crisp and clear. I immediately started listening to music and was very pleased with the performance. I've linked SXM and Amazon Music and have listened to a variety of types of music via these channels. in addition, the volume buttons have proven very useful. On top of this you get the exceptional Alexa voice app and all that it can do. I am going to buy one for each of my Christmas gift list. (My fear is they sell out!)
customer_reviews.author: dh

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Best Buy so didn't have to wait until December release. Wanted it to listen to high resolution music. It fits the bill. Alexa app. needs some work. Tech support is terrible. They don't know much about the product other than what they read on cue cards. Also, now Amazon interrupts music streams with their own commercials. Trying to sell Audible Books. 😡 Like the speaker enough to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Gaye

customer_reviews.title: Major Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I was an early adopter and have had a echo V1 since they first came out. The sound quality on the Studio is a 10X upgrade to that and it's mics are soooo much better. If you want really great, room filling sound, give the studio a try. At this price compared to the competition, you won't regret it
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoSteve

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bose.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound and easy set up. Very impressed with the whole package!
customer_reviews.author: D. Burchfield

customer_reviews.title: Almost There
customer_reviews.text: This is a phenomenal speaker; however, one suggestion, Amazon: feature an HD light. Seeing that we're paying for HD music, this speaker should indicate when an HD song appears, just like Dragonfly does. In addition, there should be different shades on this HD light to indicate 96, 48, or 24.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Gavin

customer_reviews.title: One unit doesn’t cut it, needs two for the “immersive” experience
customer_reviews.text: I’m a bit disappointed. Sound quality is good, but not the fully immersive experience I expected, even with Amazon suggested HD songs. Used paired with a subwoofer. Volume is also an issue. Doesn’t get as loud as a standard Echo. After buying I see that a paired system is what really works, which frustrates me because Amazon marketed as a lower price alternative to Sonos, but if I have to buy two, then I’m right within the Sonos range. Amazon should be more obvious about the paired system as the “immersive experience”. One by itself doesn’t cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Fantastic

customer_reviews.title: I hate the fact that IT'S NOT A BLUETOOTH SPEAKER.
customer_reviews.text: My phone's or any other bluetooth source WILL NOT connect. Amazon block the bluetooth so that wonderful Echo Studio - High-fidelity (so called smart speaker) does not have the ability to pair with ANY devices outside of the Alexa App. SO IT'S NOT A BLUETOOTH SPEAKER. IT'S AN ALEXA APP SPEAKER ONLY! This really sucks! A better purchase would be a real BLUETOOTH SPEAKER that has Alexa enabled...
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding speaker.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, especially with hd music. Microphones work better than any echo I've had. A friend with hundreds of dollars worth of sonos was blown a way by the sound of this speaker for the price! I will be getting another to replace a second gen echo in my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn S.

customer_reviews.title: Mini-toslink Input Issues
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with the sound of this echo, but there is an issue with the mini-toslink input. If this input is being used and the echo switches to a call or drop-in, the mini-toslink input doesn't return when the call is finished. Unplugging the mini-toslink and plugging back in does no good. You need to unplug the echo power and plug it back in to continue using the port. I'm hopeful this will be fixed soon but will need to return it before it's too late. I really needed the digital input for my use case.
customer_reviews.author: stevethrewup

customer_reviews.title: Great sound at reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the first and 2nd gen Echo, which I use to control my media center with the Logitech Harmony Hub. The Echos has always done their job, but the sound was always lacking when playing music. Hooked the Echo Studio up this weekend and the sound is, so much better than before. Fills our Kitchen / Living Room areas with great sound and we will definitely be putting it to use during the holidays. If you can find space for this speaker, which is a little larger than competitors, I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Howie

customer_reviews.title: Well rounded sound
customer_reviews.text: Over all this speaker is amazing. I have a Sonos before this and wanted something with more Alexa features as well as well rounded sound. None of the other Amazon speakers were as good as Sonos in audio quality. I played with a demo of this in Best Buy before I pre-ordered this. And I have no regrets. My ONLY problem is I prefer Apple Music and she doesn’t play the best all the time with it. Sometimes I’ll be randomly disconnected and have sign in again. The speaker itself is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Jessicca

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: This Echo Studio replaced a 1st generation Echo in my dining room. So setup was easy. Compatible with other Echo devices, lights, thermostat, etc in our home. The improved 3D sound quality is immediately noticeable! This is a great audio solution for a small condo like ours. No long wires or multiple speakers to hang on walls. Just plug & play. Excellent sound fills the space. But well-balanced bass, to not shake up the condo neighbors. A+.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wo

customer_reviews.title: Really great sound
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool smart speaker. The pros: Simple to setup Incredible bass Great balance of mids and highs room filling sound Stereo pairing with second studio Subtle looks Easy to pair devices I listen to music, TV and Audible books through it, and other speakers have some difficulty adjusting between the three. This one handles all three beautifully. I listen to classical, 60s -70's Rock, Grunge, singer songwriter, all sound great. This is in the category of you get what you pay for. It isn't cheap, but it isn't cheaply built either. It is well worth the money. I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick T.

customer_reviews.title: Wont play music when paired with fire tv
customer_reviews.text: Won’t play music when paired with fire tv on Samsung 9000 tv. Why is this? It does play music if the fire tv is on and select amazon music. But won’t play music when tv is off. Using 3 wiFi 6 ROG Asus routers and 2 AC routers set up in mesh network. Switched to all new cat 8, high speed HDMI and coax cables. Got a call from tech which was nice but no solution as of yet. Going to try to pair with a cube to see if that works.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Directional Sound
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this, but with Amazon HD 3D music playing on perfect WiFi, I just can’t say there is anything special with the sound quality. Just did the latest firmware update, and that helped a little, and seemed to make the sound slightly better. I definitely will not continue with Amazon Ultra HD subscription just for this, since it really is nothing special about the sound. Yes it’s better than the regular Echo, but the sound is directional with the tweeter only in the front. For the large size, I would have expected better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Y.

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Bass
customer_reviews.text: I have the bass cranked up to full and its not that great. I'm hoping it gets better as the speaker breaks in. The return window is big enough. It may go back if it doesn't improve. What the heck is the 'Action' button.. nice they can tell me the name of it but it would have been nice to include a description... The packing is outstanding, very 'Apple'
customer_reviews.author: Culmac_j

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great but it has difficulty recognize commands
customer_reviews.text: The Echo studio is a pretty good speaker. It sounds noticeably better than my Echo. It is comparable to a Sonos One. The issue I have is the Echo Studio has difficultly listen to the wake word and the command that follows. There are multiple times that I need to be at arm's length to issue the wake word. The Echo Studio right light up and then quickly disappear which left me to use the wake word again. Other Echo devices (Tap, Echo, Dot, and my Ecobee) did not have that much trouble receiving commands.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound quality. The added bass makes a difference. The setup was SUPER easy, if you own an echo device than you should know how to quickly setup a new device or even if you're new. I'm glad that Amazon finally added more languages for Alex to speak. This device is louder than any other echo.
customer_reviews.author: Ramiro

customer_reviews.title: Sound bar and sub killer!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Vizio 2.1 soundbar and subwoofer. So far I have no complaints! I was blown away at how this “small” speaker fills a room with sound! I think it’s more balanced sound compared to a sound bar, since it’s all one package. I plan on adding another one for a stereo pair and maybe a subwoofer. But for now it’s doing an amazing job! I don’t miss a subwoofer! One of these for sure could replace a $100-$200 soundbar. I also bought the 4K fire stick to get the most out of it. It’s worth the buy, especially if you get it on sale!
customer_reviews.author: ruben ramos jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great value sounds great works as a sound bar as well, hooked right up to fire cube and they work together well!!
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great value; a well-aimed upgrade to the standard Echo
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value -- a huge upgrade in sound from the base Echo speaker, and comparable in quality to the $400 Sonos speaker I have in another room. I really think this is a great choice for a good listening experience in a straightforward set-up. Like my 3 other Echo devices, this was super simple to set up and was playing my music within a few minutes of my opening the package at my front door.
customer_reviews.author: Jayhawk

customer_reviews.title: "Sound was Disappointing"
customer_reviews.text: Sound was disappointing, not a clear sound had a tinny quality to it. to much money for quality of sound.
customer_reviews.author: Style Design Group

customer_reviews.title: Does not work if you are using a VPN
customer_reviews.text: I have set up my Home Theater with 2 Studios and 1 Sub. All good; however, if I connect using a VPN (Fire Cube 2nd), there is no sound whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Vicente Matheus Mendes

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is nowhere near as good as it’s made out to be.
customer_reviews.text: Not really complaining about it. But I don’t think it’s worth the money at all. Having two other Alexa products. The last one being the echo. That only cost me $50. This cost basically $200 and I have to be honest, the only reason I bought it was for a better sound quality listening to music. Not much of a difference at all. Except it goes a little louder. Not really disappointed, but kind of Disappointed. Surroundsound? I don’t think so. I’m probably going to send it back. Everyone is different, but if you already have something like the echo. You’re not missing anything. I would stick with the echo.
customer_reviews.author: JGH

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Sound
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is outstanding for a coffee can sized speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amartn

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what the bad reviews are about
customer_reviews.text: Maybe they don't have a high enough speed connection, but this is an amazing piece of hardware. Sound quality is wonderful and far and above a regular Echo that we own. The sound dispersion is impressive for such as relatively small device. The 3D music is very noticeable quality wise as well. Not sure what people expect but it's a great device.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Mostly awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I love this speaker, in general, but have an issue with the tiered system the Amazon Music works with it. If you’re a Prime member you get Amazon Music. Ok. If you pay more, you get Amazon Music Unlimited. Ok. Now the fun part, if you have the Echo Studio, you have the capability to play HD and some sort of immersive 3D sound audio also...but now you have to also pay for that as well. It’s kinda nuts. Amazon: I’m pretty sure us buying your speakers and devices, paying for Prime, and paying for Unlimited is enough. When we buy the Echo Studio, the upgraded sound should just be available to match our upgraded speaker. Quit being so greedy.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Get a pair of Echo Studios with an Echo sub for best sound!
customer_reviews.text: I paired 2 of the studios with an echo sub and it sounds pretty decent for the price. I would like to see a way we can manually trigger a calibration rather than rely on the automatic room calibration when transitioning the set to different areas. Overall a good sound comes out of these Echos.
customer_reviews.author: A M Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Too many commercials fo Amazon music service
customer_reviews.text: When we ask Alexa to play a piece of music from our own download library, we have to sit through a lengthy commercial for Amazon music service. Once should be enough!!!! Not subject us over and over to the same thing. I don't know how to turn it off. Also it does not seem as sensitive to picking up my commands as our other older device. I have to shout Alexa instead of just saying her name as before. But.... the constant commercials for Amazon services are unforgivable .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s A lot of Fun
customer_reviews.text: I’m having fun. Still trying to understand everything that it can and can’t do. I get frustrated at times and other times thoroughly impressed with this invention. Sometimes it’s just weird. At times it’ll just turn on by itself. CREEPY! Just saying! Otherwise I like it. Being of an older, technically challenged type of person I must admit that that there’s a lot for me to learn about how to make the most of my experience with this device. Why is studio the best for instance? Speakers?
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound! LOVE THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: We have had Bose stereos and speakers for the last 20 years. My husband was very skeptical when I ordered this since it was not a Bose, and even asked if I could cancel the order since I pre-ordered and it wouldn't be delivered until it was released. I didn't cancel the order, and am so happy I didn't. Very easy to set up - just plug in and it already connects to my Amazon account off my iPad nearby. Exceptional sound and so easy to use! As for my husband, he is now this product's biggest fan! Great sound! Great product! LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: April C Strickler

customer_reviews.title: I Love Alexa and she's flattered when I say it!
customer_reviews.text: My first "Alexa" and I have it in my RV. I am absolutely loving it. Rich sound. Fills the space, utilizes low bandwidth which is important for me in an RV. I had a similar 'indoor/outdoor' speaker that was round for similar sound - the Soundcast Melody which is amazing but nearly 2x the price as the Echo Studio for the same sound quality. I also have used the 3.5mm jack at the bottom to connect to my computer. Overall, a great unit!
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Great with an Alexa-capable TV!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Echo product line! The speaker is phenomenal and sound quality is perfect. The only reason it didn’t get 5 stars is because even with a brand new smart TV with Alexa integration, every time I turn the TV on I have to manually connect the speaker with the TV. And if you don’t have a smart TV, you have to use the auxiliary/optical port which every time you use the voice recognition feature for Amazon Alexa, it mutes the line in and you can’t get it undone unless you unplug the audio cable and plug it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Angela F.

customer_reviews.title: I would wait a bit before buying
customer_reviews.text: Pros: decent sound if you have a multi echo system and are using it for music only Cons: it's massive Not loud enough to use for a fire TV system Not nearly loud enough for TV shows 3d music is still ... Strange
customer_reviews.author: Brandon creasy

customer_reviews.title: Line-In doesn't work - widespread and well-documented
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for line-in feature, but Echo has a 'feature' that turns off line-in when signal is too quiet. The only way to turn it back on is to reset the Echo, or unplug/re-plug the line-in cable. A quiet signal would include quiet parts in music, movies/tv, or if you turn off the connected device (i.e., if it's a turntable and the album ends, you'll need to restart the Echo to get it playing again). You can read more about this on forums across Amazon and Reddit, but there's been no solution so far. Definitely returning.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D. Frost

customer_reviews.title: Astonishing!
customer_reviews.text: Astonishing! Price/ Performance is off the charts ... will be adding second Echo Studio to pair with initial purchase as soon as it becomes available.
customer_reviews.author: bitbuckets

customer_reviews.title: A great speaker awaits 3D music options.
customer_reviews.text: A great speaker for the money. Setup, like all Alexa speakers, is seamless with the amazon Alexa app. The sound is great right out of the box, but if you want that perfect sound, you can adjust the audio settings via the app. My only complaint, would be the lack of 3D music available on Amazon Music HD. Hopefully more options will be added in time.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Goldsworthy

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the Alexa family
customer_reviews.text: I am exceptionally pleased with the quality of sound and the ease of installation for this product. Basically, it was a ten-minute setup, including adding it to several groups in my home. As a person who is hard of hearing, the depth of sound in these speakers makes the music I listen to much more enjoyable-- I don't need the volume to be turned up loud to hear the dots. I also appreciated that this system "sounded out" the room to adjust itself--making it appear that the entire room is filled with sound, not just the locus of the system itself. I would buy more if I had a bigger apartment... this is a great piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G

customer_reviews.title: Premium sound for the class of speaker
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Studio is an excellent product. It does deserve the 5 star rating, when you consider the price point and the features it provides. While the sound is excellent it wouldn't compare to a full Klipsch surround sound, but your also not paying 1/10th of the price. The bass and mids are excellent for such a small speaker, and the sound fills our living room perfectly. The design is very aesthetically pleasing, and it blends in with our contemporary farmhouse interior design. The microphones do a good job of picking up our voices even over the sound of music playing out of its speakers. I will definitely purchase another one of these speakers for my loft.
customer_reviews.author: LowcountryGuy

customer_reviews.title: Streaming issues, but when working sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: The sound of this device far exceeds all other amazon devices I’ve heard or have thus far. I wouldn’t say it beats Sonos though. I would give it 5 stars if not for the issues around music streaming which it’s designed for. We have an echo and this studio version on a play group and this speaker stops playing all the time. There isn’t a clear consistency either. It’s extremely annoying. We primarily use Pandora as we like the fact there station selection is the most robust, but it does it with amazon music as well. For the price the sound quality is fantastic. Just wish it’s streaming capability were consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Unger

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy for surround sound!!
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a great device, I have to give it minimal stars. I specifically bought this device as a sound bar for my amazon TV. The problem is, I have to replay up to 5-10 minutes of any video before it syncs up to actually play. I’ll go 5 minutes into a program before any audio actually is heard. And once you sync up, it is a pain in the butt to un sync it and reconnect which doesn’t always repair the problem. By itself, a great device. But don’t expect the claim that it gives you surround sound. It does when it wants to, but falls flat on regular usage.
customer_reviews.author: Justyn Acord

customer_reviews.title: Here Is A Headline
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. (For music you really need two speakers). With Amazon Music HD, the sound is good. But.....I still don't think it matches a traditional stereo setup with an amp/receiver powering passive speakers. What I wish Amazon would do with the HD service is offer an amp with the app integrated in. And with a DAC that can play the full 192/24 resolution for songs in that format. Power that through a pair of passive Klispch or Polk speakers and you might be in music heaven. You would get the best of both worlds: the hi fi sound of a traditional stereo with the convenience and cost effectiveness of music streaming. Come on Amazon......do it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D

customer_reviews.title: I've owned a lot of $500+ systems
customer_reviews.text: This sounds just as good if not better, and costs just 200 bucks. Worth it for big sound. + Alexa built in, I'm sold. I've hooked it up to my xbox via a mini-toslink to toslink cable I bought on amazon for 6 bucks to play racing games as well and it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for TV use
customer_reviews.text: The Studio is great as a stand alone Alexa speaker, but isn’t very good paired with a FireTV. You’ll constantly be annoyed by the lag between picture and sound. The sound lag on YouTube and Hulu make them completely unusable. If you don’t mind hearing the words 2-3 seconds after seeing lips move, this is the speaker for you.
customer_reviews.author: WR

customer_reviews.title: THE REAL TRUTH ABOUT ANY SUB ECHO DEVICE-MUST READ
customer_reviews.text: So here it is...plain & simple. Any Echo device that advertises quality sound...especially heavy base...be prepared to be yelling at it; And, be prepared for it not to listen. I've bought this model for the rich sound, but half the time I just end up screaming at it to "STOP!" In short, it won't catch your commands if you have the volume high. More importantly, talking to an Echo (aka Alexa) is still like talking to a 5 year old toddler. You have to speak slow & pronounce everything to the "T" if you expect to get the correct response. And that my Amazon friends, gets really old super fast!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMan

customer_reviews.title: Solid green ring of light had hard time with reset
customer_reviews.text: So the one I got turned a solid green ring and wouldnt go into setup mode right out of the box, called tech support. They couldnt figure it out. Told me to hold down two buttons to do factort reset didnt work. Why i tried this i have no idea, but i unplugged unit and continued holding down the two buttons an replugged it in. Hope this helps some of you if you encounter this.bsound quality was full and sounded good. The bass a little muddy imn my opinion. If you dont yet own an alexa or want a high end alexa this is for you, we didnt like the setup failure hence we returned it
customer_reviews.author: Snagglepuss

customer_reviews.title: Terrible as a desktop speaker
customer_reviews.text: I tried to replace my desktop speakers with this echo studio since it saved space and combined speakers and my existing echo dot. The problem is the aux in takes forever to turn on, so for cases where I'm using this for meetings, lots of sound is dropped every time there is a pause in the room and returns. They need a way to force aux input as default for this case.
customer_reviews.author: Vikram Rajasekaran

customer_reviews.title: Not much different sound than Echo.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use in Florida room. When listening to music, there isn't a huge difference between listening to my original Echo device. Would probably sound better if paired with another, but then for the price of two, might as well buy a Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Zoo

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding sound
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built and great sounding speaker for the cost. Amazon is really competing with the big brands with this one. Still evaluating the 3D music but Amazon Ultra HD music sounds fantastic on this speaker. Plenty loud and clear. Can't go wrong with this speaker.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Toye

customer_reviews.title: Finally, an Amazon Echo device that you’ll want to use as your main speaker system
customer_reviews.text: The first official Echo device to feature really great sound. I’ve been looking so long for an Alexa-integrated high-quality speaker, since the Echo and Dot don’t quite achieve that for me, and the fantastic Dolby tech integrated into the speaker pulled me towards the Studio (plus, unlike non-Amazon devices, this being an Echo device means it’s backed by Amazon’s excellent support team. If you’re looking for a speaker with great sound and worth the price, I’d highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: pgeorge08

customer_reviews.title: Not a Fan
customer_reviews.text: i’m very picky about audio and this just isn’t doing it for me. MAYBE if it was in a perfectly square room it might sound better? i’m not a fan of the “stereo spatial enhancement”, you lose things in the music. with that enhancement turned off it still doesn’t sound that great, it’s very mid heavy. you really only get good rich bass on songs that are already bass heavy otherwise you don’t get much at all. The songs that are mastered in 3-D don’t impress me at all. I would DEFINITELY purchase two third gen Echo’s and the sub over this. i’ll just Bluetooth the audio from my echo show to my sound bar and save the $200.
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: A massive upgrade over the Dot
customer_reviews.text: We went straight from an antiquated Dot - which was definitely showing its age and becoming very "laggy" to the Echo Studio. Whereas you could never really get the Dot to play loud enough, you'll find yourself saying "Alexa, turn down the volume" more than you'd expect (and that's a good thing). With shockingly good bass, and the ability to broadcast sound far beyond its immediate vicinity, the Echo Studio is a massive step forward and essentially a replacement for all but higher end home sound systems. We all unanimously agree; worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Meh.......
customer_reviews.text: With the highly rated reviews I was really expecting this to be special, but after listening to it for an hour and requesting HD music, all I can say is Meh.... It's nicer than an Echo or Echo dot, but not an Echo dot plugged into my TV's 7.2 $400 sound system. One review said it filled the room with sound. Must be a small apartment dweller. It's akin to a nice radio, but a long ways away from a good stereo. Would not recommend and will return. The included Alexia Phillips light bulb works great and is a keeper though.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Studio Sound Master
customer_reviews.text: About to purchase another one and two wireless subwoofers, this echo studio ain't nothing but the truth and I'm a Bose owner of several types (companion 2 and accoustimass 7).
customer_reviews.author: MD 20/20

customer_reviews.title: Speakers buzzy after only 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: The speaker started off nice. The 3d sound capabilities are pretty nice. I bought this for the purpose of listening to music based on the fact that its supposed to have bigger and better speakers than the smaller echos or echo plus, and also had a built in subwoofer. The sound was good until about 2 weeks after I got it. Now it just sounds buzzy and distorted. I'm pretty disappointed. I wasn't expecting Bose levels of quality, but I had expected it to last longer than 2 weeks. It still works for alexa commands, but if that's all I wanted, I would have bought a dot for $30 instead of the almost $200 for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: This is a buy now, don't wait!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest, I was hesitant to make this purchase due to the price point, but I'm so glad I did!! The quality of the sound is theater grade, and you pick up so much more with it. I had family over to watch the Polar Express this weekend, and they were all impressed with the sound, even noticing previously unobserved details in the movie because of the heightened sound quality. I'll be purchasing another to complete my home theater experience ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Another super quality audio device by Amazon, a lot of bang for your bucks!
customer_reviews.text: Not too much to add to add to the other 215 reviews. I cant explain the excellent quality any better than what has already been said. Very high-end audio device. Produces a very wide frequency response at low and hi volume levels. When placed correctly in a room the sound is expansive and wraps around you due to is well thought design, teamed up with the SUB you will have audiophile quality sound. PRICE is very comfortable for what your getting in quality. If you demand Hi fidelity sound , here you go...wont go wrong. Nice Job. Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Harris

customer_reviews.title: Volume Issues
customer_reviews.text: The low rating is for the volume issues I'm having. When listening to my tv the Echo Studio loses sound, the Echo then has to be reset by disconnecting the power cord. When listening to my fire stick 4k the volume resets to zero. I turn the volume back up and it will again reset to zero. This does this a few times and will correct itself or I will have to reset the Echo Studio by disconnecting the power cord.
customer_reviews.author: R. Langill

customer_reviews.title: Refuses to listen- red ring of light
customer_reviews.text: Two months after I bought and set up the Echo Studio the red ring of light (so devilish) came on and the microphone stopped working. Alexa no longer listened to me. The published solution is to push the microphone button which unmutes the microphone which I’ve somehow muted. But when I push the button for four seconds she searches for a WiFi network. I bought Alexa to listen to me and despite my considerable research and pressing all of her buttons in various combinations the ring of red light remains. Sad. I feel rejected. She, at least, remains a lovely blue tooth speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Vanek

customer_reviews.title: Lacked balance
customer_reviews.text: It was excited. But then turned to sadness once I opened and installed the unit. As an audiophile and gadget guy it "sounded" to good to be true. Everyone said. "hey where's the bass sound" so they threw in a bass speaker. But no matter how you tune. Volume low Got nice crisp high range but muffled bass Turn it up. Bass over powers with it's muffled bass. And no high end Tried to go to their app and tune. Couldn't get around the lack of balance Going back to my little tall echo. Crisper cleaner sound. And I can do without the muffled bass and a heck of a better orice
customer_reviews.author: Music Dude

customer_reviews.title: Constant Reboots or Re-pairing Needed - Would Not Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: While the sound is very good, I find that I have to reboot the speaker at least once a day. There are also times when rebooting doesn't work and I'm forced to unpair the speaker from my Sub. Re-pairing fixes the issue in the short term. That makes it unacceptable. I would not buy again. BTW, I have 4 other Echo speakers, none of which require constant reboots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Connected to Echo cube and PC
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound coming out of this for Amazon video programs that support the dolby Atmos. I then wanted to see how it works as a PC speaker. I purchased the optical cable with the 3.5mm end for connecting to the Studio. Not Bad as a PC speaker. It does duty wirelessly for Amazon shows on my HDTV and wire connection for the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Big upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Seriously nice sounding speaker! nice job Amazon! Speaker is 100 times better than an echo spot 3rd gen. im only listening to a single speaker set up. it actually sounds close to stereo. you can hear the soundstage. bass is pretty clean. im anxious to pair it with a second speaker for true stereo. i see it has mini 3.5 optical in. haven’t heard of this but if you can do audio out from tv or cablebox that would cool for mini home theater set up. i also havent had any issues with audio dropping out but i’ll follow up after i have this a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Kenbola

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and the Echo Sub and they sound great. I only hope the neighbor doesn't hear the sub. Maybe I shouldn't worry about it. The Echo Studio pair without the "Sub" base unit sound great on their own, just not as much bass. I love the fact that i can adjust the sound with the equalizer on my Echo app. (treble, mid-range, and bass) I recommend. I had the first generation Echo which I still love, and i have the Prime music subscription which is great with some 20 million cd's to play. With this you have a "library" on line and create your own play lists.
customer_reviews.author: Bumper Warehouse

customer_reviews.title: THE KING OF ALEXA SPEAKERS
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is simply excfellent. Now this bad boy is perhaps 2-3 times larger than it's smaller cousins so think about where you want to put it. The soundbar for my TV was nearly two thousand dollars but I believe pairing two Echo Studios would give me better sound at less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Eisenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Audio cuts out for a second or two every few minutes
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this so I could pair this with my Fire TV 4K. The audio cuts out for a second or two every few minutes. I contacted support which they had factory reset it, but the same issues exists. After researching online, I see a lot of customers have this issue. I don't know if this is a hardware issue or a software problem, but it's a problem. I don't think it is a hardware problem since streaming music works flawlessly. When I have the Fire TV 4K play audio from the TV speakers, there is no audio cut out.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, unless you want a stand alone powered speaker. Do not wast your money!
customer_reviews.text: Sono"s 100% blows this away, sound, connectivity, Group, Multi-Room and if you can get, Example: Echo Show 2nd Gen to group (You can, but not easy, remember only 2 Alexa devises plus Amazons Subwolf), you just lost all of you grouped Sono's speakers. DO NOT BUY! my opinion!! Amazon needs a lot of firmware updated to compete with Sono"s not even close!! Very disappointed in Amazon to put this product out!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers not great home theatre
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to love it. The sound as speakers are incredible. Full sound in the highs and lows. Also purchased the subwoofer which adds even better bass. Why I don’t love it, well I purchased the set specifically as a home theatre system. When it works, the sound is incredible. Unfortunately it disconnects from my 4K firetv constantly. Just about everyday, half way through the movie. So I’m left having to stop it and restart it so it reconnects. I’ve gotten to the point where I’ve umpaired my 4K firetv from the speakers because it was so annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Pair with another for excellent stereo sound!
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound for the size and power. Pairs well with another studio to fill a room. Wish it would accept bluetooth connections as well. Note, once paired it doesn't seem to be able to act as a speaker for other Echo base systems like Dot or Show. But works well by itself/themselves and sounds great!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Syncing and Stuttering
customer_reviews.text: I can’t not recommend this device. I have to reboot this device regularly because of stuttering issues. WiFi is solid though my small apartment so connectivity shouldn’t be an issue. Also, in combo with the FireTV, if I rewind whatever media I’m watching, 9/10 times the audio/video will be out of sync. Audio quality is good. Alexa integration is fine but these two issues are crippling and highly annoying. I would go to optical input to eliminate these issues but then I lose most of the benefit of this wireless speaker , including not being able to transmit Atmos and 3D audio.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar F.

customer_reviews.title: Even if you have a smart fire tv don’t buy this for a sound bar.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t work well as a sound bar. If I have it on 75 volume or less it’s basically a whisper. I bought an optical/toslink cable in hopes that it would fix the issue but no luck. I’m using it with a smart fire tv also, still has poor sound on lower volumes for sound bar usage. At this point I may as well just use the tv speakers. I’m pretty disappointed with this product and don’t know what else can be done. Maybe further updates will fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer 29659824658934

customer_reviews.title: It fills the room with excellent sound.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is Wow! The sound is amazing. I have had various Bluetooth and other all in one speakers like this and this is the best so far. None of the others could fill a room like this can. With Spotify already attached to my account I can actively switch between any Echo including the Studio with easy control through the Spotify app as well as with Alexa voice control. It is now about 4 months old and going strong.
customer_reviews.author: John V Magisano

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Studio versus HomePod
customer_reviews.text: Utmost honesty, I have both Apple and Amazon/Alexa environment in my townhouse including smart gadgets. However, I initially bought Homepod and set it up that was not as friendly as I expected, when I found out that I couldn’t access Pandora, iHreart that’s what it turned me off and I did returned it back at Best Buy and bought Amazon Studio that was so much easier to activated and I was fascinated with its bass sound that I am enjoying it every beat of it.
customer_reviews.author: David Kevorkian

customer_reviews.title: I love this speaker!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this speaker. I use it for casual listening, mood music and love it. I listen primarily to classic rock and blues as background music. Dont get me wrong, I do find myself occasionally quietly listening with my eyes closed. This speaker sounds great, it just doesn't have the detail of a high fidelity system. No suprise there as it's a tenth of the price. I did notice underemphasized mids in some tracks such as Stevie Nick's Leather and Lace, but overall I still prefer the Studio over my Sonos One. I can't help but smile when listening to Pink Floyd or B.B. King. It's a fabulous speaker!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This does not having enough mid range nor does it have clarity. It gets loud but that's it. The single tweeter is way to directional any shift to any side that you move and it instantly sounds muffled. Decent bass but again no mid range so you have directional highs no mids and low end I hope amazons next generation adds more tweeters mids and better DSP. If all you care about is output you will love this. Anyone who knows quality sound balanced sound will hate this.
customer_reviews.author: AudioPhile

customer_reviews.title: It works very well
customer_reviews.text: So I just got it and it sounds really good, I have all the levels from the dot to the echo plus and now this one. It is the best one by far reflected in the price, But I would have to say the Echo plus is still very good and so far (with0ut hearing 3D extra music enhanced sound) Its a pretty good upgrade. Honestly I wish Amazon would just include a few 3d songs for free so as a buyer I could listen for myself but for now it is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: John Augustine

customer_reviews.title: Good soundstage and audio quality...
customer_reviews.text: Good soundstage and audio quality if you subscribe to amazon unlimited + HD/SHD. However, this speaker sounds very ordinary with lower quality audio sources. It’s a studio speaker that reveals the flaws and brilliance of your audio source. Buy an alexa enabled Bose speaker if you don’t plan on purchasing an Amazon subscription service. Alexa Integration would be 5 stars if the speaker had a small lcd display to e.g. show title, album art, clock....
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Rosebrock

customer_reviews.title: Alexa gets confused and it’s not as smart as she think she is
customer_reviews.text: More difficult to set up than I thought it took me longer and more attempts finally came together I am still having a problem with my Amazon music only plays for about a minute and then shuts off I have to go through my Spotify and use my phone to control the system I have nine devices in the house four small Echo dots one second generation echo two third generation Echo One first generation echo Echo sub wooferAnd last but at least the 3-D studio echo great sound when they all Play together
customer_reviews.author: Harlan D. Brandsgard Jr

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated / Returned
customer_reviews.text: Both Google and Amazon have nice smart speakers, but both are far from where they should be. In the end, I bought a smart TV with Chromecast and Amazon Prime, and Google Max speakers. Hopefully, either Google or Amazon will get there, but it's still in Beta, as far as I'm concerned. The sound is really good. Linking two Echo Studio and one Echo Sub is maddening. Amazon's customer service needs to be revamped. In order to keep call time moving, Amazon constantly switches the customer from one agent to another. Each time, the new agent needs time to read through the notes. That's not customer service, but rather customer disservice. I remain a loyal Amazon customer. I remain hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: Jim McAfee

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Been using this speaker for a few weeks now and completely enjoy it. I have it in my townhouse in a open room about 40’x15’ and it fills the room with perfect sound. I had owned all the other Echo speakers before this one and this blows the previous products away!
customer_reviews.author: Fran Szypula

customer_reviews.title: Echo Studio sounds great just playing music.
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Studio sounds great, just playing music from amazon music or apple music or any other streaming services. Where it shines is with an amazon music HD subscription. It seems the music is coming from all around. The louder the volume, the better the sound, especially with ultra HD 3D music. If this will be your first echo device, you can't go wrong. I think I own most of the devices, and this is the best one yet hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Best Sound on a $200 speaker
customer_reviews.text: The music is so clear and surrounds you. The Elvis Presley Ultra HD is the best I've ever heard. I'm 77 years old. So I've been listening to Elvis music for a lot of years.
customer_reviews.author: Hop  good game

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. Happy to answer questions.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I might “like” this product, but I ended up LOVING it! We had an Alexa dot but I wanted something with better sound quality, this had really good reviews so I was hopeful. After we got it home and set it up it was the perfect stereo system for our living space and we love how well it fits our space. Our neighbor drove by one day and could hear it from outside and asked what kind of stereo we were using. Very happy with the product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alone or a pair these devices sound great but at a cost
customer_reviews.text: I tried the echo 3rd gen pair with sub and it was good. 2 of these studios IMHO is better. Overall sound is better. Echo sub was kinda disappointing. It's small and cheap so it does what it's suppose to I guess but for my limited kitchen area I wanted as few devices and wires as possible. A pair of studios sounds great but pricy at 400$ for the pair. But compared to Google or Sonos or Bose at the same price, these studios win as a pair.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker At A Fair Price....
customer_reviews.text: There’s many fine reviews that leave little to add. One point of personal view though is the Amazon prices that are fixed to their products. Whether it be speakers, tablets, or earbuds I feel that Amazon is extremely fair in their pricing of products. I’m an Apple guy owning IMac, Ipad, and phone. The thing is Apple’s pricing is in my opinion extremely greedy, I mean something isn’t right when a new phone comes in at $1,000 plus. Given that, as long as Amazon attempts to approach pricing fairly I will always remain a loyal customer.....
customer_reviews.author: R.A.H.

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted more wow sound from my Echo Dot. I am not that impressed. At lower volumes it does not sound any better than my Echo Dot. At higher volumes it doesn't have me saying that sounds great. Maybe I was expecting too much. However considering it's more than 6 times the cost of an Echo Dot it shold leave me feeling that I really have something exceptional. The sound is not that great. I'll keep playing with it and see if I can get it to perform at a level that makes me feel it was worth the extra $.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worst microphones ever
customer_reviews.text: The worst Alexa that I have ever owned. I can stand over the top of this and speak, i’ll have Alexa’s in another room pick up before this one. The sound quality is great, but it’s absolutely useless if I can’t communicate with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Flippin Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: Glad Amazon finally got with the program and offered “HD” & “Ultra HD” music, although I do believe Tidal has a very slightly better sound. In either case this Echo Studio rocks! Very nice, full, crisp sound with Amazon HD stream; this speaker will fill just about any size room. We have an open floor plan with about 1,200 sf combo kitchen, living, dining and family room and this Echo is all we need for a impromptu dance party.
customer_reviews.author: J Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound, wish it paired with dots though.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is absolutely amazing. I was completely blown away by It! The only reason for not giving 5 stars is because of connectivity issues. I was under the impression that I could use the studio as a center/main channel and use two dots as side speakers for surround but apparently that's not an option at the moment, I was told the studio could only pair with another studio. Well, somehow I did get it to pair with both dots (just not simultaneously) and if they could just update the devices to work together seamlessly then it would be a truly versatile sound system. But without that capability, it's still just another Alexa, not a sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Jvoles

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile, but I do listen to music just about all day long while I work. In the past, I've purchased high-end equipment from Bose and Tivoli. The Echo Studio certainly stands up to those brands, and for a fraction of the price. Setup is quick and easy, and the sound quality is a noticeable improvement over the standard Echo, of which I've owned several over the years. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The studio is rich and clear in sound. Remember to adjust the audio to your liking in the Alexa app. I've tried several genres and they all sounded fantastic with good sound separation. Good job Amazon, and in keeping the cost affordable!
customer_reviews.author: JAZZY62

product_meta.title: Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker with 3D audio and Alexa
feature_bullets: Immersive sound – 5 speakers produce powerful bass, dynamic midrange, and crisp highs. Dolby Atmos technology adds space, clarity, and depth.
Ready to help - Ask Alexa to play music, read the news, and answer questions.

Voice control your music - Stream songs from Amazon Music, Apple Music, Spotify, Pandora, Tidal, and more. With Amazon Music HD, listen to 50 million songs in the highest quality audio formats available, HD, UltraHD and 3D.
Adapts to any room - Automatically senses the acoustics of your space, fine-tuning playback for optimal sound.
Built-in smart home hub - Ask Alexa to control Zigbee-compatible devices.
Keep your family in sync - Use your Alexa devices like an intercom and talk to any room in the house with Drop In and Announcements.
Designed to protect your privacy - Built with multiple layers of privacy controls, including a microphone off button that electronically disconnects the mics.
